alert.note: Alert for Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 3:38PM PST until March 02 at 2:52PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County. .Showers will diminish today and will not contribute to raising the river levels on the Skookumchuck River. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 213.0 feet, the Skookumchuck River in Thurston County will flood several residential and business areas around Bucoda. Flood waters will cover many roads * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 213.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 PM PST Tuesday was 213.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above moderate flood stage and crest near 213.3 feet, then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling. - Flood stage is 211.5 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 1245 AM PST.
